v.v: Call out now; is there anyone who will answer you?
For anger kills the foolish man;
I have seen a foolish person taking root,
His children are far from safety;
The hungry eat up their harvest;
For difficulties do not come out from the soil;
Instead, mankind is born for trouble,
But as for me, I would turn to God himself;
he who does great and unsearchable things,
He gives rain on the earth,
He does this in order to set up on high those who are low;
He breaks the plans of the crafty people,
He traps wise people in their own crafty actions;
They encounter darkness in the daytime,
But he saves the poor person from the sword in their mouths
So the poor person has hope,
See, blessed is the man whom God corrects;
For he wounds and then binds up;
He will rescue you out of six troubles;
In famine he will ransom you from death,
You will be hidden from the scourge of the tongue;
You will laugh at destruction and famine,
For you will have a covenant with the stones in your field,
You will know that your tent is in safety;
You will also know that your seed will be great,
You will come to your grave at a full age,
See, we have examined this matter; it is like this;

v: To which of the holy ones will you turn?
jealousy kills the silly one.
but suddenly I cursed his home.
they are crushed in the city gate.
There is no one to rescue them.
they even take it from among the thorns.
The thirsty pant for their wealth.
neither does trouble sprout from the ground.
just as sparks fly upward.
to him I would commit my cause—
marvelous things without number.
and sends water on the fields.
to raise to safety those who mourn.
so that their hands cannot achieve success.
the plans of twisted people are hurried to their end.
and grope at noonday as if it were night.
and the needy person from the hand of mighty people.
and injustice shuts her own mouth.
therefore, do not despise the chastening of the Almighty.
he wounds and then his hands heal.
indeed, in seven troubles, no evil will touch you.
and in war from the hands of the sword.
and you will not be afraid of destruction when it comes.
and you will not be afraid of beasts of the earth.
and the beasts of the field will be at peace with you.
you will visit your sheepfold and you will not miss anything.
that your offspring will be like the grass on the ground.
like a stack of grain bundles that goes up at its time.
listen to it, and know it for yourself.”
